abstracts.cdata!:
The Paraguay Reform Project for the
            Water and Telecommunications Sectors; Argentina SEGBA V
            Power Distribution Project Request for Inspection examines
            claims made by the The Federation of Persons Affected by
            Yacyreta in Itapua and Misiones (Federacion de Afectados por
            Yacyreta de Itapua y Misiones - FEDAYIM) on its own behalf
            and on behalf of the more than 4,000 families affected by
            alleged violations of the Bank.  The claims allege that the
            World Bank has violated policies and/or procedures dealing
            with environmental policy for dam and reservoir projects,
            environmental assessment, involuntary resettlement,
            supervision, project monitoring and evaluation, and
            supervision of disbursements.  The Requesters claim that In
            the course of designing and building the Yacyreta
            Hydroelectric Project, each of these policies was violated.
            This occurred because the financing banks were unwilling to
            carry out proper supervision and monitoring of the work.
            This led to nothing more than the dismantling of productive
            systems; community structures and social connections were
            weakened and families were dispersed.
